page.title: 05 THE VILLAGE STORES
page.content: One of the village shops is owned by Mr and Mrs Grogan. The building housing the Village Stores is about 200 years old. Next door to the Village Stores there is a tea shop also owned by the Grogans. The tea shop building is much newer than the other building. About 90 people a day use the Village Stores. Their biggest sales are newspapers, with food as their next biggest sale. The tea shop closes down in the winter and opens up in the summer mostly for passing trade. About 40 people use the tea shop on a fine summer's day and Saturday is their busiest day. The shop sells a large variety of goods. There are no permanent workers other than Mr and Mrs Grogan.
